tangamanga.title: Tangamanga Park
tangamanga.subtitle: The Green Lung of San Luis Potosí - Where Nature Meets Adventure

history.title: History & Cultural Significance
history.meaningText: The name "Tangamanga" comes from the Huachichil language, an indigenous group that once inhabited the region. It translates to "meeting place" or "place of gathering", reflecting the park's role as a central social and cultural hub for the community.
history.creationText: Inaugurated in 1980, Tangamanga Park was created as part of an ambitious urban development project aimed at providing green spaces for recreation and leisure. The project was a response to the growing need for public spaces in San Luis Potosí, as the city was experiencing rapid urbanization.
history.impactText: Over the years, Tangamanga Park has become much more than just a green space. It has evolved into a fundamental gathering point for the Potosino community, hosting countless cultural events, festivals, and community activities.

attractions.title: Main Attractions
attractions.natural1: Botanical garden with diverse plant species

activities.title: Activities & Events
activities.family3: Guided tours of the botanical garden

biodiversity.title: Biodiversity
biodiversity.text: The park hosts a rich diversity of flora and fauna. In its more than 420 hectares, you can find various species of native trees, migratory and resident birds, as well as small mammals and reptiles. The botanical garden is especially important for the conservation of endemic species in the region.

centroHistorico.title: Historic Downtown
centroHistorico.subtitle: The Colonial Heart of San Luis Potosí - Where History Comes Alive

intro.title: Welcome to the Heart of San Luis Potosí
intro.paragraph1: The Historic Downtown is much more than a collection of old buildings: it's the living soul of the city. Every plaza, every alley, every pink quarry facade tells a story dating back over four centuries.
intro.paragraph2: Here, past and present coexist in perfect harmony. While admiring the majesty of colonial architecture, you can savor specialty coffee in an 18th-century courtyard, explore contemporary art galleries, or enjoy the city's finest gastronomy.

history.title: History & Heritage
history.originsText: Founded in 1592, San Luis Potosí was born thanks to the region's mining wealth. The Historic Downtown preserves the essence of over four centuries of history, with baroque, neoclassical, and colonial buildings that narrate the grandeur of New Spain.
history.architectureText: The Historic Downtown is an open-air museum with over 1,500 catalogued historic buildings. The pink quarry stone, characteristic of the city, adorns the facades of temples, mansions, and government buildings. Every street reveals architectural treasures that transport you to another era.
history.todayText: Far from being a frozen museum, the Historic Downtown pulses with life. Cafés in colonial courtyards, contemporary art galleries in 18th-century buildings, and gourmet restaurants in old mansions create a unique fusion between past and present.

pointsOfInterest.title: Points of Interest
pointsOfInterest.landmark1: Plaza de Armas - The heart of the city with its kiosk and gardens
pointsOfInterest.landmark3: Teatro de la Paz - One of Mexico's most beautiful theaters
pointsOfInterest.landmark5: Government Palace - Living history with Fernando Leal murals
pointsOfInterest.museum1: National Mask Museum - Unique collection in Mexico
pointsOfInterest.museum2: Federico Silva Museum - Contemporary art in the Old Hacienda

gastronomy.title: Gastronomy & Nightlife
gastronomy.intro: The Historic Downtown is a gastronomic paradise where tradition and innovation meet. From century-old cantinas to author cuisine restaurants, every corner offers a memorable culinary experience.
gastronomy.restaurant1: La Gran Vía - Traditional cuisine and historic ambiance since 1940
gastronomy.restaurant3: La Oruga y la Cebada - Author cuisine
gastronomy.restaurant5: La Posadita - Mexican cuisine and bohemian vibe
gastronomy.bar1: Chau! Resto - Cocktails and modern atmosphere
gastronomy.bar4: Catrina Rooftop - Terrace with panoramic views
gastronomy.bar5: El Callejón del Beso - Bar in historic alley
gastronomy.market1: Mercado Hidalgo - The main market since 1906
gastronomy.market2: Mercado República - Crafts and street food

nightlife.title: Entertainment & Nightlife
nightlife.text: When the sun sets, the Historic Downtown transforms. The plazas light up, street musicians appear, and bars open their doors. From concerts at Teatro de la Paz to jazz nights in colonial courtyards, downtown offers entertainment for all tastes. On weekends, pedestrian streets fill with life through cultural events, food fairs, and artistic performances.
nightlife.tourText: One of the best nightlife experiences is exploring the bar zone on foot. Within a few blocks you'll find:
nightlife.spot1: El Ricardito - Best vinyl and music bar in town, small but incredible vibes
nightlife.spot2: Rockabilly - Rock music and retro atmosphere
nightlife.spot3: Las Bóvedas - Unique space in historic architecture
nightlife.tourTip: All within walking distance, perfect for a safe and fun bar crawl.

shopping.title: Shopping & Crafts
shopping.artisansText: The Historic Downtown is the best place to find authentic regional crafts. From the famous Santa María del Río rebozo to high-quality leatherwork, each piece tells a story of artisanal tradition.
shopping.item1: Santa María del Río Rebozos - Century-old textile tradition
shopping.item2: Leatherwork and leather goods - Belts, bags, saddles
shopping.item3: Traditional sweets - Queso de tuna, charamuscas, glorias
shopping.item4: Ceramics and talavera - Unique decorative pieces

hiddenGems.title: Downtown Secrets
hiddenGems.intro: Beyond the tourist sites, the Historic Downtown holds secrets that only locals know. Here we reveal some of our favorites.
hiddenGems.gem1Text: A hidden passage with art galleries and bohemian cafés. Perfect for a quiet afternoon of exploration.
hiddenGems.gem2Text: Many buildings preserve spectacular interior courtyards. Enter to admire fountains, gardens, and intimate architecture.
hiddenGems.gem3Text: At sunset, the pink quarry stone glows with warm tones. The best time for photography at Plaza de Armas.
hiddenGems.gem4Text: Streets close to traffic. Families, cyclists, and pedestrians take over the streets in a festive atmosphere.

practical.title: Practical Information
practical.gettingThereText: Uber and taxi are the most comfortable options. Downtown is very walkable once you arrive.
practical.parkingText: Several public parking lots around downtown. Avoid pedestrian streets.
practical.safetyInfoText: The Historic Downtown is one of the safest areas in the city, with constant patrol and good lighting.

tips.title: Visitor Tips
tips.tip1: Wear comfortable shoes - streets are cobblestone
tips.tip2: Visit on weekdays to avoid crowds
tips.tip3: Sundays have fewer cars and more pedestrian life
tips.tip4: Bring cash for markets and street vendors
tips.tip5: Ask locals for recommendations - they're very friendly
tips.tip6: Explore the alleys - that's where the hidden gems are

funFacts.title: Fun Facts
funFacts.fact1: The Historic Downtown has over 1,500 buildings catalogued as historical heritage.
funFacts.fact2: The pink quarry stone that adorns the buildings is extracted from local quarries and is unique to Mexico.
funFacts.fact3: Benito Juárez established Mexico's capital here in 1863 during the French intervention.
funFacts.fact4: Teatro de la Paz was inaugurated in 1894 and is considered one of the most beautiful theaters in Latin America.
